meanings.definition: To make something more complex or difficult than necessary.
meanings.sent1: She kept overcomplicating the recipe by adding too many ingredients.
meanings.sent2: Stop overcomplicating the instructions; just follow them step by step.
meanings.sent3: John was overcomplicating the game rules so much that no one wanted to play with him.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a tangled web, overcomplicating every decision she made.
meanings.sent5: The artist's attempt to overcomplicate the painting only resulted in confusion for the viewers.

meanings.definition: The act of adding unnecessary complexity to a situation.
meanings.sent1: The overcomplicating of the project led to delays in its completion.
meanings.sent2: His constant overcomplicating of simple tasks frustrated his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The overcomplicating of the party planning turned it into a chaotic mess.
meanings.sent4: The overcomplicating of the story made it hard for the audience to follow.
meanings.sent5: The overcomplicating of the budget caused confusion among the team members.
